p: Several classes of compounds have been described in Nectandra spp., such as alkaloids (Santos Filho and Gilbert 1975), phenylpropanoids (Garcez et al. 2009), sesquiterpenes (Romoff et al. 2010) and lignoids (Gottlieb 1972). Antileishmania activity (Silva-Filho et al. 2008) has been described for some lignans and neolignans (Le Quesne et al. 1980; MacRae and Towers 1984; Silva-Filho et al. 2004). Despite this, there have been no studies addressing the antileishmania activity of essential oils from Nectandra species.
